weight.light: Under 9.5 oz - easier to maneuver, less powerful
weight.heavy: Over 10.5 oz - more power and stability

head_size.midsize: 85-95 sq in - more control, smaller sweet spot
head_size.midplus: 95-105 sq in - good balance of power and control
head_size.oversize: 105+ sq in - more power, larger sweet spot

materials.nylon: Most common, durable, good for beginners
materials.polyester: Control-oriented, used by pros, less comfortable
materials.natural_gut: Best feel and power, expensive, less durable
materials.synthetic_gut: Good balance of performance and cost

maintenance: Restring regularly (every 3-6 months for regular players)

court_surfaces.clay_court: Herringbone pattern, slides well on clay
court_surfaces.grass_court: Small nubs for traction, rare specialty shoe

fit_considerations: Should fit snugly but not tight

grips: Grip size affects comfort and control
